C39E3EA2359C473AB452BDC78BB63D68.description:
Conduct structured investigations to answer questions about which materials have the
properties that are best suited to solve a problem or need.

C64BE2912FFC416494F60C3F377B1F7F.description:
Develop and use models to describe and compare the properties of different materials
(including wood, plastic, metal, cloth, and paper) and classify materials by their
observable properties, by their uses, and by whether they are natural or human-made.

09AC208BC0B041E5AE345FE69EE18F7A.description:
Analyze and interpret data to compare the qualitative properties of objects (such as size,
shape, color, texture, weight, flexibility, attraction to magnets, or ability to sink or float)
and classify objects based on similar properties.

57BB2D9469F947AC8BEDBA733BF55765.description:
Objects can be described and classified by their observable
properties, by their uses, and by whether they occur naturally or are manufactured (human-made).
Different properties of objects are suited for different purposes.

89993A5A25864849A16827C42CFBAEDD.description: Physical Science: Exploring Properties of Objects and Materials

B9FCC268D9484E0E8FFB0ACC3887D304.description:
Define problems caused by the effects of weather on human activities and design
solutions or devices to solve the problem

C797BF31C95A488BACFFAC31AFE27DA0.description:
Obtain and communicate information to support claims about how changes in seasons
affect plants and animals.

B43B17EAE6F24151B88C0AC13B639DA3.description: Develop and use models to predict seasonal weather patterns and changes.

CFF26B56B6A74963A4D4277AE07CE4E1.description:
Analyze and interpret local weather condition data (including precipitation, wind,
temperature, and cloud cover) to describe weather patterns that occur from day to day,
using simple graphs and pictorial weather symbols.

FDFAE328B99847BE96DA29B8D6DAE1AF.description:
Weather is a combination of sunlight, wind, snow or rain,
and temperature in a particular region at a particular time. Scientists measure weather conditions to
describe and record the weather and to notice patterns over time. Plants and animals (including
humans) respond to different weather conditions in different ways.

6733E682A4364942AF551A242709501A.description:
Obtain and communicate information about the needs of organisms to explain why they
live in particular areas.

AB958CE76AE34B44887F78AA06E6971B.description:
Construct explanations from observations of what animals need to survive and grow
(including air, water, nutrients, and shelter).

AD5FEFCA8C8B4B88A6B150E5FF7DFC05.description:
Analyze and interpret data to describe how humans use their senses to learn about the
world around them.

428E8AA9BC6C4AB0A32BAA8338EDFAD7.description:
Develop and use models to exemplify how animals use their body parts to (1) obtain
food and other resources, (2) protect themselves, and (3) move from place to place.

5AF726A462B8406D959F04EB84D3AC1A.description:
Conduct structured investigations to determine what plants need to live and grow
(including water and light).

ED8F2FC778D1455D8CCB726838D27880.description:
Obtain information to answer questions about different organisms found in the
environment (such as plants, animals, or fungi).

128E258FD3564998A1668A37724DD4C6.description:
The environment consists of many types of organisms
including plants, animals, and fungi. Organisms depend on the land, water, and air to live and grow.
Plants need water and light to make their own food. Fungi and animals cannot make their own food
and get energy from other sources. Animals (including humans) use different body parts to obtain
food and other resources needed to grow and survive. Organisms live in areas where their needs for
air, water, nutrients, and shelter are met.

C37885E4844D474D9BDB5A63F367B957.description: Life Science: Exploring Organisms and the Environment

DBC864CFD8B94E0CA8347600F6463A4B.description:
Construct devices or design solutions to solve specific problems or needs: (1) ask
questions to identify problems or needs, (2) ask questions about the criteria and
constraints of the devices or solutions, (3) generate and communicate ideas for possible
devices or solutions, (4) build and test devices or solutions, (5) determine if the devices
or solutions solved the problem, and (6) communicate the results.

01969F631EBD4549AEE78CED8EEB64E3.description:
Technology is any modification to the natural world created
to fulfill the wants and needs of humans. The engineering design process involves a series of
iterative steps used to solve a problem and often leads to the development of a new or improved
technology.

878DA643183649ECB40A94C2BD6C53DB.description:
Obtain and evaluate informational texts, observations, data collected, or discussions to
(1) generate and answer questions about the natural world, (2) understand phenomena,
(3) develop models, or (4) support explanations. Communicate observations and
explanations using oral and written language.

25BE3E0A5E084020AEBEB48C8B0DF1B9.description:
Construct scientific arguments to support explanations using evidence from observations
or data collected.

B3EC9CAE49EA4676AFED9BD765DE0FAA.description:
Construct explanations of phenomena using (1) student-generated observations and
measurements, (2) results of investigations, or (3) data communicated in graphs, tables,
or diagrams.

1A04F1D931B24A42956A4300387D54EF.description:
Use mathematical thinking to (1) recognize and express quantitative observations, (2)
collect and analyze data, or (3) understand patterns and relationships.

E6FFCF5710B24E1A85C3B4273D5B08BE.description:
Analyze and interpret data from observations, measurements, or investigations to
understand patterns and meanings.

746FA39714054D708796E0A824939C14.description:
With teacher guidance, conduct structured investigations to answer scientific questions,
test predictions and develop explanations: (1) predict possible outcomes, (2) identify
materials and follow procedures, (3) use appropriate tools or instruments to make
qualitative observations and take nonstandard measurements, and (4) record and
represent data in an appropriate form. Use appropriate safety procedures.

E4A4CCAA39B44AB79CE104E716599FA3.description:
Develop and use models to (1) understand or represent phenomena, processes, and
relationships, (2) test devices or solutions, or (3) communicate ideas to others.

D478487C5B1D4085ADE10AB1C7A9BE7A.description:
Ask and answer questions about the natural world using explorations, observations, or
structured investigations.

7D3D68C435F94D01862B1BC91BE9BC58.description:
The practices of science and engineering support the
development of science concepts, develop the habits of mind that are necessary for scientific
thinking, and allow students to engage in science in ways that are similar to those used by scientists
and engineers.
